class_notes: The delivery format listed for this class is based on current university guidelines. However, if there are further changes to the COVID19 guidelines for Fall 2021 or other acts beyond our control, the school reserves the right the modify the delivery method for this class
course_description: This course is an introduction to the theory and practice of finance. Specifically, it covers topics such as the time value of money, net present value (NPV), internal rate of return (IRR), valuation, analysis of risk and return, capital markets, and a firm's capital structure. The goal is to gain an understanding of finance and the financial instruments and models typically utilized for both individual and corporate decision making. Among the tools used in the learning process will be the required textbook, articles, problems/cases, and, of course, classroom lecture/discussion.
prerequisites: This section is reserved for students in the One-Year or Two-Year MBA program.
